name: JenkinsDownloadArtifacts
description: Download artifacts produced by a Jenkins job
helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by a [Jenkins](https://jenkins.io/) job.
author: Microsoft

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Jenkins service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service connection for your Jenkins instance. To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Jenkins service connection.

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Jenkins job to download artifacts from.  This must exactly match the job name on the Jenkins server.

inputs.name: saveTo
inputs.label: Save to
inputs.helpMarkDown: Jenkins artifacts will be downloaded and saved to this directory.  This directory will be created if it does not exist.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuild
inputs.label: Download artifacts produced by
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by the last successful build, or from a specific build instance.

inputs.name: jenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Jenkins build number
inputs.helpMarkDown: Download artifacts produced by this build.

inputs.name: itemPattern
inputs.label: Item Pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify files to be downloaded as multi line minimatch pattern. [More Information](https://aka.ms/minimatchexamples)

The default pattern (\*\*) will download all files across all artifacts produced by the Jenkins job. To download all files within artifact drop use drop/**.

inputs.name: downloadCommitsAndWorkItems
inputs.label: Download Commits and WorkItems
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enables downloading the commits and work item details associated with the Jenkins Job

inputs.name: startJenkinsBuildNumber
inputs.label: Download commits and work items from
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional start build number for downloading commits and work items. If provided, all commits and work items between start build number and build number given as input to download artifacts will be downloaded.

inputs.name: artifactDetailsFileNameSuffix
inputs.label: Commit and WorkItem FileName
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional file name suffix for commits and work item attachments. Attachments will be created with commits_{suffix}.json and workitem_{suffix}.json. If this input is not provided, attachments will be created with the name commits.json and workitems.json

inputs.name: propagatedArtifacts
inputs.label: Artifacts are propagated to Azure
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this if Jenkins artifacts were propagated to Azure. To upload Jenkins artifacts to azure, refer to this [Jenkins plugin](https://wiki.jenkins.io/display/JENKINS/Windows+Azure+Storage+Plugin)

inputs.name: artifactProvider
inputs.label: Artifact Provider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the external storage provider used in Jenkins job to upload the artifacts.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the artifacts.

inputs.name: storageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager stoarge accounts are listed. Select the Storage account name in which the artifacts are propagated.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in the storage account to which artifacts are uploaded.

inputs.name: commonVirtualPath
inputs.label: Common Virtual Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the artifacts inside the Azure storage container.
